perturbation.original_text: Any income or employment taxes due for a year on the value of current life insurance coverage provided to the Employee under this Agreement will be the responsibility of the Employee. To the extent that the value of current life insurance coverage is taxable income, it will be subject to withholding requirements and will be reported as income by the Employer to the IRS and state-taxing authorities on the Employee's W-2 Form or other IRS or state-required reporting form to the extent required by law.
perturbation.changed_text: Any income or employment taxes due for a year on the value of current life insurance coverage provided to the Employee under this Agreement will be the responsibility of the Employee. To the extent that the value of current life insurance coverage is taxable income, it will be subject to withholding requirements and will be reported as income by the Employer to the IRS and state-taxing authorities on the Employee's W-2 Form or other IRS or state-required reporting form to the extent required by law.
perturbation.explanation: Moving the tax responsibility clause to the 'Interpretation' section buries a critical financial disclosure in boilerplate language, making it less noticeable to the employee. This obscurement could lead to misunderstandings regarding tax obligations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: US Tax Laws - Requirement for clear communication of tax liabilities.

perturbation.original_text: This Agreement will be governed by the laws of the State of Pennsylvania.
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement will be interpreted according to general business principles, and while the parties intend to operate in accordance with the laws of the State of Pennsylvania, specific disputes will be resolved based on the principles of fairness and equity as determined by the Employer.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause specifies Pennsylvania law. The modification introduces ambiguity by suggesting 'general business principles' and 'fairness and equity as determined by the Employer' can override state law. This creates a contradiction regarding which legal standard applies, weakening the enforceability of Pennsylvania law.

perturbation.original_text: The Employer will keep possession of the Policies. The Employer agrees from time to time to make the policies available to the Employee or to the "Insurer" for the purpose of endorsing or filing any change of beneficiary on the Policies but the Policies will promptly be returned to the Employer.
perturbation.changed_text: The Employer will keep possession of the Policies. While the Employer may, at its sole discretion, make the policies available to the Employee, there is no obligation to do so and the Policies will remain under the Employer's control.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the language ensuring the policies would be made available to the employee to change beneficiaries. This alters the power dynamic, potentially hindering the employee's ability to manage their beneficiary designations effectively.
